required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Intratumor CpG-ODN Boosters Immune Killing Against in Situ Tumor Antigen Release for Advanced Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: Intratumor CpG-ODN Boosters Immune Killing Against in Situ Tumor Antigen Released by Interventional Approaches for Advanced Solid Tumors

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital of Guangzhou Medical University

collaborator.agency: Guangdong Zhaotai InVivo Biomedicine Co. Ltd.

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital of Guangzhou Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: To study the safety and clinical effects of intratumor injecting CpG-ODN and in situ release of tumor antigen by interventional ablation or drug-eluting beads to treat advanced solid tumors.

detailed_description.textblock:
1. Percutaneous microwave ablation or intratumor injection of drug-eluting beads to destroy cancer cells to release tumor-specific antigens
2. Intratumor injection of type A/C CpG-ODN with or without infusion of CAR-T cells secreting scFv against OX40
3. Assessing side effects and therapeutic efficacy after the combined treatments

primary_outcome.measure: Assessing safety and treatment efficacy on intratumor injection of CpG-ODN and in situ tumor antigen release for advanced tumors
primary_outcome.description: Assessing incidence of side effects and primary clinical response of the intratumor injection of CpG-ODN and therpeutical in situ tumor antigen release for advanced tumors, including CR, PR, SD, and PD.

intervention.description: CAR-T cells secreting scFv against OX40
intervention.other_name: Interventional therapy technique including microwave ablation or drug-eluting beads

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Solid advanced malignant tumors
- Age between18 and 80 years
- Life expectancy is greater than three months
Exclusion Criteria:
- Benign tumor
- Life expectancy is less than three months
- Serious medical comorbidity
- Others

overall_official.affiliation: Second Affiliated Hospital of Guangzhou Medical University

facility.name: The Second Affiliated Hospital of Guangzhou Medical University
